alert.note: Alert for Misty Fjords; Southern Inner Channels (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 30 at 6:40AM AKST until January 01 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...A SIGNIFICANT STORM TO END AND START THE YEAR... .A strong system is expected to move over the entire Panhandle on Friday. This system may produce 4 to 18 inches or more of snow by New Years Day, then slowly move south through Sunday with additional accumulations likely. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 15 inches possible for Ketchikan and Metlakatla. Hyder may see accumulations of 20 to 26 inches. * WHERE...Southern Inner Channels and Misty Fjords, including Ketchikan, Metlakatla, Thorne Bay, Kasaan, Hollis, and Hyder. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest rates expected Friday night to early Saturday. A transition or changeover to rain is expected in Ketchikan and much of the southern Inner Channels Friday night; however, Hyder will remain all snow.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
